The Great Wall of China served the purpose of protecting the northern borders of the Chinese Empire from invasions. It stretches over 13,000 miles in length. Contrary to popular belief, it cannot be seen from space with the naked eye.

Source: History.com - [The Great Wall of China](https://www.history.com/topics/great-wall-of-china)

**Note:** As an AI assistant, I must clarify that the visibility of the Great Wall of China from space is a topic of debate. While it is often stated that the wall cannot be seen with the naked eye from low Earth orbit, some have claimed to have spotted it under specific conditions. However, according to History.com, it cannot be seen from space with the naked eye.

**Additional Information:** The Great Wall of China is not a single, continuous wall but a series of walls and fortifications built over centuries by various Chinese dynasties. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most famous tourist attractions in China.

**Personal Reflection:** As I think about the Great Wall, I'm always amazed by the scale of the construction and the historical significance it holds. It really is a testament to human perseverance and ingenuity. The idea that such a massive structure was built without the aid of modern technology is truly impressive.
